thread.title: Khloe Kardashian's ex Lamar Odom found unconscious at brothel
thread.title_full: Khloe Kardashian's ex Lamar Odom found unconscious at brothel

title: Khloe Kardashian's ex Lamar Odom found unconscious at brothel
text:
Khloe Kardashian's ex Lamar Odom found unconscious at brothel Khloe Kardashian's ex Lamar Odom found unconscious at brothel 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Khloe Kardashian’s former husband Lamar Odom has been taken to hospital after he was found unconcious at a Nevada brothel. 
Nye County Sheriff’s Department was called to the Love Ranch in Crystal, about 70 miles from Las Vegas to a report of an unresponsive man needing an ambulance. 
He was stabilised and taken to Desert View Hospital in nearby Pahrump, the statement said. 
Officials then tried to have him airlifted to Las Vegas, but the 6ft 8in former NBA star was too tall for the helicopter and he was driven by ambulance to Sunrise Hospital and Medical Centre. There was no further word on Lamar’s condition. Lamar Odom played for the Los Angeles Clippers (Jae C Hong/AP) 
The emergency call came from Richard Hunter, media director for Dennis Hof, who owns the Love Ranch and other brothels in Nevada, the sheriff’s statement said. 
Lamar, 35, last played in the NBA in 2013 and saw reality TV fame through his four-year marriage to Khloe. She filed for divorce in 2013, citing irreconcilable differences. 
The two were married in 2009 in a large ceremony that was taped for the E! network, which screens Keeping Up With The Kardashians, following a whirlwind engagement that was also filmed. Lamar Odom and Khloe Kardashian (Dan Steinberg/AP) 
Troubles that faced Lamar before and during his basketball career appeared to worsen after he left the league, and included a no-contest plea to drink-driving shortly before his divorce. 
He won two NBA championships with the Los Angeles Lakers in 2009 and 2010, and most recently played for the Los Angeles Clippers during the 2012-13 season. In February last year, he signed with a Spanish team on a two-month deal but a month later he returned to the US because of a back injury. 
In 2006, Odom’s six-month-old son Jayden died from sudden infant death syndrome while sleeping in his cot in New York. He has a daughter Destiny and a son Lamar Jr, from a previous relationship. Share article 
Mr Hof, who had his own reality series, Cathouse, on HBO, said Lamar had been staying at his home attached to the brothel since October 10. He said the former sportsman “wanted to get away from everybody, wanted to have fun”. Promoted Stories
